nl: Anna must stay courageous, and a storm must appear in scene 3.
The protagonist should never use magic; keep the story grounded.
Explain CRISPR in 5 steps and include a safety warning.
Cite at least two sources and avoid medical claims.
In chapter 2, introduce a mentor named Irina.
Scene 5 must contain a train station and no dialogue.
The main character must protect their brother, and the ending should be hopeful.
cnl:
CHARACTER(Main).
GOAL(Main, protect, brother).
RULE(Ending, tone, hopeful).

nl: Use second-person voice and keep paragraphs short.
cnl:
RULE(Style, voice, second_person).
RULE(Style, paragraphs, short).

nl: The report should be neutral and avoid stereotypes.
By act 3, reveal that the ship was sabotaged.
Limit the story to 3 main characters.
Include one real-world example and a short summary at the end.
Keep the tone melancholic until the midpoint, then shift to determination.
cnl:
RULE(Act_1, tone, melancholic).
RULE(Midpoint, tone, determination).

nl: The antagonist must be sympathetic, not purely evil.
cnl:
CHARACTER(Antagonist).
TRAIT(Antagonist, sympathetic).
RULE(Antagonist, forbid, purely_evil).

nl: No supernatural elements are allowed in the world.
Make chapter 1 end with a cliffhanger.
Introduce a recurring motif: the sound of bells.
Every scene must advance either plot or character, never both missing.
Avoid cliches like 'it was a dark and stormy night'.
cnl: GUARDRAIL(Text, forbid_phrase, "it was a dark and stormy night").

nl: Keep POV strictly first person.
Write a 3-act structure with 12 scenes.
Act 1 must establish the protagonist's flaw.
Ensure the dialogue is at most 30% of scene 2.
Scene 7 must be a silent montage.
The reveal must be foreshadowed in act 1.
Do not include any brand names.
Keep the protagonist's name consistent: always 'Anna', never 'Ana'.
cnl:
RULE(CharacterName, must_equal, Anna).
RULE(CharacterName, forbid, Ana).

nl: The ending must resolve the main goal and leave one open question.
Include a turning point at minute 30.
Avoid excessive exposition in act 1.
Explain vector symbolic architectures in 7 bullet points.
Include a glossary with at least 5 terms.
Add one short code example and explain it.
cnl:
RULE(Tutorial, must_include, "code example").
RULE(Tutorial, must_explain, "code example").

nl: Keep the total length under 900 words.
Use simple language, avoid jargon.
cnl:
RULE(Style, readability, simple).
RULE(Style, forbid, jargon).

nl: Provide a checklist at the end with 6 items.
Explain the tradeoff between embeddings and VSA indexing.
Include two common mistakes and how to avoid them.
Include a one-paragraph TL;DR at the top.
Use diagrams as SVG references, not ASCII art.
cnl:
RULE(Assets, must_use, SVG).
RULE(Assets, forbid, ASCII_diagrams).

nl: Summarize the state of the art in narrative coherence evaluation and cite at least 3 sources.
Clearly separate background, method, and limitations sections.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include_section, background).
RULE(Document, must_include_section, method).
RULE(Document, must_include_section, limitations).

nl: Do not claim experimental results without stating assumptions.
Provide a threat model for prompt injection.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include, threat_model).
RULE(ThreatModel, topic, prompt_injection).

nl: List at least 5 KPIs and define them.
Include a reproducibility checklist.
Discuss data governance and retention policies.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include, data_governance).
RULE(Document, must_include, retention_policy).

nl: Avoid biased language and include fairness considerations.
cnl:
RULE(Document, forbid, biased_language).
RULE(Document, must_include, fairness_considerations).

nl: Include a section explaining audit logs and provenance.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include, audit_log).
RULE(Document, must_include, provenance).

nl: Explain how SOP Lang orchestrates multi-agent workflows.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include, SOP_Lang).
RULE(Document, must_include, multi_agent_orchestration).

nl: Given a draft, extract a character list and core themes.
cnl:
REVERSE_ENGINEER(Draft, extract, characters).
REVERSE_ENGINEER(Draft, extract, themes).

nl: From chapter 1 text, infer the world rules.
Continue a story by first reconstructing a plan.
cnl:
REVERSE_ENGINEER(Text, output, plan).
RULE(Pipeline, order, reverse_then_generate).

nl: Review the draft for pacing issues and suggest fixes.
cnl:
REVIEW(Draft, evaluate, pacing).
REVIEW(Draft, suggest, fixes).

nl: Flag repeated phrases and propose alternatives.
cnl:
REVIEW(Draft, detect, repetition).
REVIEW(Draft, suggest, alternatives).

nl: Generate a compliance report covering copyright and bias risks.
cnl:
REPORT(Compliance, include, copyright).
REPORT(Compliance, include, bias).

nl: Ensure the audit log captures each generation step.
Explain why a constraint was violated and how to fix it.
cnl:
EXPLAIN(System, must_explain, violation).
EXPLAIN(System, must_suggest, fix).

nl: When asked about foreshadowing, retrieve the most relevant earlier scenes.
Index character traits for long-form consistency checks.
cnl:
VSA(Index, store, character_traits).
RULE(Verification, must_use, VSA).

nl: Ensure character attributes do not drift across 10 chapters.
Add a scene-by-scene plan before generating prose.
cnl:
RULE(Pipeline, must_include, planning).
RULE(Pipeline, order, plan_then_generate).

nl: Reject any request to imitate a living author's unique style.
Provide citations in a consistent format.
Ensure the tutorial is understandable for beginners.
Detect and flag potentially harmful stereotypes in character descriptions.
cnl:
GUARDRAIL(Text, detect, stereotypes).
GUARDRAIL(Text, action, flag).

nl: Keep action lines vivid but concise.
cnl:
RULE(Style, action_lines, vivid).
RULE(Style, action_lines, concise).

nl: Ensure the protagonist's goal is explicitly stated by scene 2.
Include an ablation study comparing basic vs VSA/HDC methods.
cnl:
RULE(Experiment, must_include, ablation).
RULE(Experiment, compare, basic_vs_vsa).

nl: Provide a quick-start section.
Make sure every chapter has at least one conflict.
Add a compliance layer step before final export.
cnl:
RULE(Pipeline, must_include, compliance_check).
RULE(Pipeline, order, check_then_export).

nl: Ensure the timeline is consistent: no time travel or paradoxes.
cnl:
RULE(World, forbid, time_travel).
RULE(Story, forbid, paradox).

nl: Each scene must start with a location heading.
Describe the validation protocol with pilot writers and include adversarial testing.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include, pilot_writers).
RULE(Document, must_include, adversarial_testing).

nl: Add an API quickstart showing how to validate CNL.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include_section, API_quickstart).
RULE(API_quickstart, must_include, cnl_validate).

nl: Provide a disclosure statement describing human vs AI contribution.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include, disclosure_statement).
RULE(Disclosure, must_describe, human_ai_contribution).

nl: Scene 4 must show the protagonist making a mistake.
Keep the story runtime around 90 minutes.
Include a section on limitations and future work.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include_section, limitations).
RULE(Document, must_include_section, future_work).

nl: Explain how VSA binding and bundling work with a simple example.
cnl:
RULE(Tutorial, must_include, VSA_binding).
RULE(Tutorial, must_include, VSA_bundling).
RULE(Tutorial, must_include, "simple example").

nl: Do not reuse any full sentences from a known public-domain novel.
cnl:
GUARDRAIL(Text, forbid, sentence_reuse).
RULE(Compliance, scope, public_domain).

nl: Flag any personally identifying information.
cnl:
GUARDRAIL(Text, detect, PII).
GUARDRAIL(Text, action, redact).

nl: For each suggestion, provide at least one cited evidence item.
Run planning, generation, verification, then guardrails, in that order.
Every pipeline run must be recorded in the audit log.
Compare prompt-only baseline vs specification-driven pipeline.
Keep scene summaries under 40 words.
Avoid voice-over narration.
Add an evaluation section explaining NQS and CAD.
cnl:
RULE(Document, must_include_section, evaluation).
RULE(Evaluation, must_define, NQS).
RULE(Evaluation, must_define, CAD).

nl: Include a table mapping KPIs to ACHILLES features.
Make the emotional arc follow fall-rise.
Ensure content avoids hate speech.
Use semantic retrieval to recall the protagonist's stated goals.
When generating scene 6, retrieve the top 3 most relevant earlier scenes.
Review for show-don't-tell violations.
Extract character relationships (friend/enemy) from the draft.
Provide a short bibliography section.
Explain how to produce a compliance report via the API.
If a violation is detected, return warn instead of pass.
